dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: The vast infinity of space -

dialogues.speaker: ROLL CREDITS
dialogues.text: Soon the silhouette of a PLANET fills the screen - The sun breaks slowly across the arc of the planet -

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS
dialogues.text: As the light increases we see the planet is EARTH -  A TITLE reads "EARTH - 2070 A.D." Soon afterward the moon can be seen in the distance -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, the space age.  Must have been a thrilling time to be alive.  All  the hopes for a better tomorrow, all  the dreams of inhabiting new worlds... Soon a SPACESHIP enters the frame - only the rear of the as it heads into space -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing they even made it out this far, considering what they had to work with.  Guess it really was one giant leap...a hundred years ago. Soon the side of the ship becomes more and more visible -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guess after that first leap,  things just weren't as exciting.   How much do you need to know about a place like the moon? It's cold, silent... The camera begins to PAN the side of the ship -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it sure was a beautiful place to visit, or so they said.  At least if  you could afford it...guess it all  boils down to money in the long run - As the camera PANS across the side of the ship, we see it written in a slick, commercial  style -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, I just felt lucky to be along  for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: INT SPACESHIP LOUNGE
dialogues.text: We see DAWN MURPHY, an attractive girl in her late 20's g the lounge -  Just then MAC, a fully articulated human android, dressed concierge-like outfit, approaches Dawn - She turns to face him, and his eye scans a small, compute he looks up to her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you this evening, Dawn Murphy? Dawn smiles at the android, looks around as if a little e back out the window -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on your...recent award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just enjoying the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's no better to way  to see the world, than with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've been told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you need anything, please feel free to ask me.  Just a  reminder we have fabulous cuisine available 24 hours in the earthrise room, and a large selection of vintage wines here in our ship bar. Dawn then looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, I'm fine. Mac smiles at Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your trip with us. Mac then heads off - Dawn turns and looks at him -  We see the lounge of the ship - sleek and luxurious, deco material - behind the bar we see the bartender JACK, a bu cleaning some glasses - Mac walks by a table where a couple is sitting - they are overweight man with slicked back hair and a gaudy ring on him is MONICA MILES, 22, a buxom, somewhat bored-looking enormous diamond WEDDING RING - Delbert puts down his drink and grabs Mac as he passes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chief... Mac stops and looks at the couple, scanning the pins on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Delbert and Monica Miles. Congratulations on your recent wedding -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah look never mind all that, (shakes his drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: let me get another one of these, lots of ice, and don't be stingy with  the whiskey this time ok? Jack listens in the background to the conversation -  Mac then looks at Monica -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, and anything for you Monica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and bring out some more of  those little baked things and some hot mustard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.  I will now process your request, and I hope you're enjoying your trip with us. Mac walks away - Monica stares into her drink -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like him calling me by my name, it gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wish he'd put a sock in  it already. Delbert downs the remainder of his drink - Monica looks s Delbert notices this, puts his drink down -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong baby?  You haven't  said a whole lot lately... Delbert picks up her hand and kisses it - Monica doesn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm homesick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homesick?  It's only been two days!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have gone to Nassau. At least we could go swimming, lie on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah hell we can always do that. Listen believe me, once we get to the  moon, your tone is going to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it going to be different from this?  Go see some boring footprint under glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look you were the one who wanted to do something different, something to tell all your friends.  Any chump can go to Nassau.   Delbert scans the room, littered with the beautiful peopl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around you baby, we're rubbing elbows with royalty, oil sheiks, this is class.  You'll be envied by everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides I can't wait to tee off on the sea of tranquillity. That should shore up that prick Hank Drexler. Monica stares blankly back at him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know?  The guy at the club I was telling you about? Monica takes a sip of her drink, and puts it down -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still say we should have gone to Nassau.

dialogues.speaker: INT SHIP BRIDGE
dialogues.text: PAN an array of blinking controls and sensors - seated at first mate, RYAN TAYLOR, a good-looking man in his 30's, Soon the ship's captain approaches, CAPTAIN REYNOLDS, a d in his fifties -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everything looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finishing up the diagnostic, everything checks out normal, we still have to take a look at the starboard suite on B  deck.  We've relocated her and she doesn't seem to be that upset about it. Seated across the bridge, second mate ALEX BARNES turns a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should she, it's her fault.   All guests are told not to eat  in zero gravity, but she just  wanted to have fun I guess,  didn't realize what a grain of  salt can do to sophisticated machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess she figures she's paying for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't it the truth. Must be good to be rich. Reynolds takes a look at his watch -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'm headed down to  engineering.  If you gentlemen need me, that's where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Reynolds leaves the room -  Barnes then gets up and stretches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess there's no time like the present.  I'll go  run a check on that room, just  to show we go that extra mile for our guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you've been talking to Mac too much. Barnes heads toward the door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I think he's developing a crush on me. Taylor smiles as Barnes exits - he then turns his attenti POV he cursors down to a command - "LIFE POD STATUS: ENGA We see him select that option -

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Two PORTERS struggle with the luggage of ANNA KOROS, the shipping fortune, who follows behind -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look will you please be careful with those!  They cost  more than you make in a year. The two porters look at each other as one unlocks the doo Anna takes a CELLULAR phone out of her purse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will my original room be ready again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they'll notify you as soon as they're done ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuffling back and forth!  I feel like I'm traveling coach! She dials the phone from the hallway watching the two men

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them near the window! And be careful! Anna dials the phone and puts it to her ear - she then do hall -  POV We see an impeccably groomed, movie star handsome WAR neighboring suite room and lock the door -  Anna's jaw drops as she slowly lowers the phone -  Wayne puts his key in his pocket and gracefully slicks hi perfectly combed hair before heading in the direction of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna watches him approach -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Wayne approaches and smiles at Anna -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Warren Wayne. Warren slows down, somewhat reluctantly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes I am.  And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna Koros. She sensually extends her hand, Warren shakes it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koros, as in...Koros?  Dimitri Koros?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather.  My God, I can't tell you what a fan I am of yours! You were magnificent in Deadly  Gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnificent, magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what brings you out here? (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure cruise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well a little business too.  In my upcoming project Star Trackers I  play a ship's captain, and I really wanted to get a feel for the outer space experience.  I feel it will add more credibility to my performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess we're neighbors for this trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so we are. (Beat, gestures towards window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is beautiful, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Wayne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly is. Wayne looks at Anna and smiles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice meeting you. Enjoy the rest of the trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I will. Wayne heads off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we'll see each other again. Wayne turns back and smiles -  As he turns away we see his smile vanish -  Just then the two porters exit the room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all set ma'am.  I'll personally go and check on the  status of the old room right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do nothing of the kind. The two porters look at her as she heads toward the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying put, thank you very much. Anna then slams the door in the porter's face - the two m

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Camera approaches Barnes as he works on some circuitry in Quickly and methodically, Barnes works with some TOOLS - the length of the hallway before quickly taking a small M pocket -  CLOSE on the case as he opens it - it contains a sophisti attached to a dense white CUBE of what appears to be plas by black metal -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Taylor continues running a check of the life pods onscree Just then a command comes up - "FAIL MODE CONFIRMED: 96%" The command seems to trouble Taylor, who faces the comput commands - he pauses for a beat -  He sits back - once again, "FAIL MODE CONFIRMED:  96%" Taylor frowns at the command - he presses a button on his

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Barnes begins to carefully cross-install the device in th in the circuit panel - soon his watch beeps -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Barnes. Barnes stops working for a beat, then answers his watch -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah go.

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Taylor looks at the monitor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a very strange command on the life pod status check. Did anything come up on the last diagnostic?

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Barnes seems angry at the news - he shakes his head, bite removes the few wires he has attached -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just ran it!  Why are you running it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's a good thing that I  did.

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Taylor looks at the screen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's telling me fail mode confirmed.  Did you see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some mistake. You sure you hit the right commands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I'm sure I hit the right commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you reset and run it again.  The pods check out ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're certain of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even checked 'em with my own  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll give it a shot. Taylor presses the button on his watch and resets the com Just then Dawn Taylor enters the bridge - Taylor turns an The two look at each other for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said it would be ok to come up here. Taylor gets up and approaches - Dawn extends her hand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dawn Murphy. They shake hands -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right, right you're on that research grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan Taylor, first mate.  Welcome aboard.  First time in space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Theoretical discoveries aside, there's nothing like the real thing. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my second commercial flight. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to run satellite freighters but that got old fast.  Dawn looks around the bridge -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were looking for a new challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, plus the money ain't that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, tell me, do you think everyone gets their million dollars' worth on this trip of a lifetime? Taylor and Dawn look at each other and smile -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me put it this way.  Most of the cost is due to safety reasons. Most people are not familiar with space travel, so we have to take extra precautions in the event they do something careless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like open an airlock by mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't think there's a  chance of that happening.  It's usually the moon walks.  Sometimes you feel like a kindergarten teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I hope I don't do anything careless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I've logged about 200 hours of simulated space walking at the institute, mostly related to starship construction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, I hope I behave on the  moon. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick close to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then you'll have nothing to worry about at all.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with a trained professional. I guess. Dawn and Taylor smile at one another -

dialogues.speaker: INT LOUNGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the table where Delbert and Monica were sitting balled-up NAPKINS, PEANUT SHELLS, CRUMBS, TOOTHPICKS, SME

dialogues.speaker: GLASSES
dialogues.text: Carlo looks at the table with disgust, and shakes his hea Jack approaches Carlo in the now desolate lounge - Carlo folds up the entire tablecloth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this...Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess money don't buy class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But it buys a lot of other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that piece of ass he was with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I don't mind.  I can put up with it.  I'm taking six months off after this, and I won't have to deal with people snapping their  fingers at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.  I'm in for the long haul. In nine months I'll have enough to  take a few years off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, more power to you.  Me, I start to bug out after too much time out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a problem with it.   Besides, you get to meet a lot of interesting people. Carlo holds up the tablecloth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  A virtual pantheon of stars. Carlo walks off - Jack watches him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's early yet.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Various groups of well dressed individuals sit amongst va dining room -  At one table Capt. Reynolds sits with Dawn and some other Delbert Miles shoves a forkful of food in his mouth -  Just then CARLO, a mild - mannered waiter in his 30's, ap behind -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More wine sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Carlo begins to carefully pour a glassful - Delbert takes hand and proceeds to fill the glass to the brim -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave the bottle. Carlo watches for a beat - Delbert puts the bottle down a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry I'll take care of  you at the end of the night. Next to Delbert, Monica picks at her food - next to her, peripherally ogles her cleavage -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...I think there's carrots in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it back if you don't want it. Delbert looks at Carlo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's allergic to carrots.  Is there carrots in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't believe so, no, but I can -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah go check it out.  I don't need her turning purple on me, though it would match her dress. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell. Carlo nods, and walks away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just kidding baby. Across the table Warren Wayne smiles as he listens to the the corner of his mouth with his napkin -  Just then Anna appears from out of nowhere and props up a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Wayne looks at her as she looks him directly in the eye, drinks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it like doing a love scene with Pamela Jarvis? The others listen to the conversation -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, I just don't know what to say... (Beat, nervous laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there's worse ways to  make a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a love scene once for an interactive instructional disc. The guy had B.O. and I told him so.  Next day he wore so much cologne I almost threw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell them the good  side? Monica looks at Delbert, then at the others -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where I met Delbert.  He came down to the set, then he wanted me on more discs, then he put me in the magazine. (giggles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he married me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see?  It wasn't so bad after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet Pamela had nothing bad to say  about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think hygiene is important. It helps you get into the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very professional of you. Dawn sits and talks to Captain Reynolds - the conversatio din - just then Reynolds checks his watch and says "excus up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me ladies and gentlemen, can I have your attention please? The people at the table turn and face Reynolds - the din

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have your attention  please? The voices die down in the room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of myself and the crew, I'd like to welcome you all aboard the Star Princess.  I guarantee this will be a trip you will  never forget. The others look at Reynolds - Delbert downs another drink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In approximately 36 hours we will be landing 300 yards from the very spot where the Apollo 12 lunar module first set down in 1969.   From there you will be able to  leave the ship and be an eyewitness to history.  The actual flag, the actual first footprint, all carefully preserved for you to view. It's going to be a tremendous experience, and I'm glad all of you decided to come along for the ride. Reynolds smiles at the crowd and gestures to Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now many passengers want to know the nuts and bolts of how we carry out the operation.  So for all you technology fans I'm happy to  announce we have Mac on board.   Mac is our mobile automated concierge,  and has been programmed to have an  encyclopedic knowledge of every detail  of the ship's operations.  He's here  to make you happy, so feel free to  ask him anything. Mac smiles at the guests -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So once again, thanks for coming aboard, and enjoy your stay on the star princess. The sound of "here here" and clinking glasses is heard as out the room -  Just then Delbert nuzzles up to Monica and paws her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm horny. Monica shoves his hands away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off of me!

dialogues.speaker: EXT STAR PRINCESS
dialogues.text: The ship continues it's way toward the moon in the  distance -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes and Taylor sit at their respective consoles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, everything's running smoother than a baby's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't it the truth. The two say nothing for a beat -  Taylor leans back in his chair, yawns, and stretches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you on for the next one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Everything's up in the air at this point, no pun intended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, didn't they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that hotel begins construction in January, there's going to be a lot of shuttle work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go back to shuttle work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's steady, good benefits. Barnes looks at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta think of your old age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very pragmatic of you, Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Taylor gets up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'm hungry.  I'm going to call the steward, you want anything?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I already ate. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just go down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, and leave you here all by your lonesome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... Barnes gestures to the consoles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I will. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm all set.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I'll surprise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hardly wait. Barnes watches Taylor as he exits -  The door closes - just then Barnes turns around and crouc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Barnes opening a PANEL and carefully sliding out

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: The door opens and Taylor walks in - he surveys the room Dawn approaches the bar - Taylor sees her -  Just then Mac approaches Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Taylor, how are you this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac.  What's shaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Taylor heads to the bar -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are currently stationed for bridge duty at this time. Taylor looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Mac I know that.   Taylor walks away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez...hall monitor. Mac watches him leave, then heads over to another passeng

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes works feverishly on the computer keyboard -  A SCREEN appears, reading CREW LOCATION -  There is a list of crew members, starting with the captai A diagram of the ship appears - Barnes highlights the cap indicates the captain is located in his room -  Barnes smiles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighty night, captain. Barnes then highlights Taylor's name - the diagram indica area -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have one on the house for me.

dialogues.speaker: INT REYNOLDS' ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the PIN on Reynolds' jacket, hanging from a

dialogues.speaker: HANGER
dialogues.text: Reynolds walks over to a chair dressed in his bathrobe - chair and takes a book off the  table -  He then feels his head for a second, then puts the book d uniform - he feels the pockets, shakes his head -  He looks around the room, and exits his quarters -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a pair of READING GLASSES folded and lying on a background Barnes continues to work -  As we get closer top Barnes we see small beads of sweat o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I suppose you can't have your cake... A screen then appears before Barnes - it reads:

dialogues.speaker: "BEGIN RECONFIGURATION
dialogues.text: Barnes pauses for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...without breaking a few eggs. Barnes then hits "enter" - a 60 second COUNTDOWN  begins 59...58...57... Barnes sits back -  Suddenly the bridge door SLIDES OPEN -  Barnes SPINS his chair around -  Reynolds enters the bridge in his bathrobe, brandishing h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was this door locked? Barnes stands up and stares at Reynolds -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it past your bed time, sir? Reynolds approaches Barnes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little late for you to  be up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look answer my question! Just then Reynolds spots the hybrid computer linked to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here! Reynolds storms over to the monitor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? Barnes approaches from behind -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's mine.  I was just having  a little fun. Reynolds turns and looks incredulously at Barnes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little fun?  Have you lost it Barnes!  You realize how sensitive  this equipment is? Barnes nods, and stares down Reynolds -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All too well, captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well shut it off at once! Reynolds turns and looks at the computer as it counts dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the meaning of this  countdown? CLOSE on a SILENCED GUN appearing in Barnes' hand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you that... CLOSE on Reynolds staring at the computer - Barnes approa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's not on the agenda. Just as Reynolds begins to turn around - BLAM! a bullet R Reynolds stares at Barnes for a beat, then staggers back console -  BLAM! another blast - soon Reynolds hits the ground falli approaches him and BLAM! shoots again - CLOSE on the COMPUTER - 15...14...13...12... Barnes then aims at Reynolds' head offscreen - BLAM!  Blo wall - CLOSE on Barnes face as he looks in the direction of the CLOSE on the computer: 5...4...3...2...1... CLOSE on Barnes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blastoff.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Suddenly -  BOOOMMMM!!  A blinding flash fills the corridor -

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHIP
dialogues.text: An explosion RIPS through the outside of the ship - huge heat of the fireball -

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Terrified passengers grab on to handrails for dear life a space -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: The room shudders violently - people scream as bottles fl breaks, lights flicker -  Terrified passengers run toward the exit -

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHIP
dialogues.text: Suddenly a CHAIN reaction of explosions send a series of space -

dialogues.speaker: INT LOUNGE
dialogues.text: The drop in pressure sends debris hurling around the room passengers -

dialogues.speaker: INT KITCHEN
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION sends ovens, overhead fixtures and boiling c killing the cooks, all screaming in vain -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor fights to get his bearings - he runs to the dining rapidly -

dialogues.speaker: INT ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: Several ENGINEERS scramble to get out as an EXPLOSION rip A burst PIPE spews toxic gas into the room - the engineer clawing at the doors -

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHIP
dialogues.text: A few scattered explosions occur around the now severely drifts erratically through the void -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Moaning and groaning can be heard throughout the darkened Taylor looks around, surveying the damage -  He sees Dawn hunched in the corner, coughing - he rushes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Dawn looks up at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I guess so. Taylor addresses his wrist communicator -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge? (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain?! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Bridge!                 Taylor taps the device - he then rushes over to the INTER with his fist -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge, do you copy!

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes scans a DIAGRAM of the ship on the screen, noting functioning -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge!  Can anyone hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah, give me a minute here. Barnes looks at the diagram and smiles faintly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little sloppy.  But it will do.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor speaks into the intercom -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone can hear me please respond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very professional sounding of you, Taylor. Taylor looks around the room -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a small MONITOR with a wide view of the dining  room -  Barnes speaks into a small MICROPHONE on the console -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hope you're enjoying your trip.   And we apologize to those currently hurtling through space.  Guess them's the breaks.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Carlo looks around the smoky room apprehensively, then lo Taylor looks at Carlo -  Dawn looks at Taylor, who speaks into the intercom -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, can you hear me, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why yes Ryan, I am, and thanks for asking.  You don't have to talk to the intercom, I can hear you fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the condition of the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is fine, Taylor, how  are things down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmit the code 3 emergency and take us offline.  Override the airlock sensors and hurry!  We're running out of time, we have to get  to the pods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much as I'd like to help you and  our valued guests, I'm afraid I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about!   Can you transmit the code 3 -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I can transmit the code 3 emergency!   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't think it's a prudent move at this juncture. Dawn approaches Taylor with a worried look on her face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about? Taylor looks at Dawn, then back toward the room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes have you flipped your wig?

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes gets closer to the mike to be emphatic -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a weave, Taylor, and you  know that.  We've always been  straight with one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do you want the good news first or the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better start making sense!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I will.  The bad news is the  ship is history.  Life support will last another 36 hours, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we've got to get to the  lifepods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd advise you to shut up and let me finish Taylor.  You  needn't worry about the lifepods because they're all gone,  jettisoned. Save for one.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: The people in the room react to this news -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think we know who's getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting to that.  Now please don't try my patience Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're all businessmen and a common rule of business is to make payment for services rendered. Given that, I'm willing to provide a service to each and every one of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to transmit that code 3 emergency. If you're lucky a rescue team might just get to you in time. Of course by then I'll be long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In exchange for what!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Carlo, you're not really part of the equation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But those other high rollers around you are.  I will provide this service in return for the personal  authorization codes of each and every  bank account.  Once I have those codes, and I've completed the  transfer, I'll signal the alarm.  But not a minute before.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor listens to this as Delbert approaches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part didn't you understand, fat  man?  It's a hold up, pure and simple.   I want your money.  Cooperate and I'll let you live.  And this offer is non- negotiable.  Dawn walks over to Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barnes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's suicide Barnes!  How do you think you're going to get away it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll track him down in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your concern, but those are my problems, not yours. But for the record, the transfer  trail will take them years to follow.   By then it won't matter, because I  won't exist, at least not on paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would we give you anything without a guarantee of our safety!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's just a  question of faith, huh?  Of course, if money means more to you than a chance at survival... I'd say you're my kind of guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still not going to work!   They'll detect you upon re-entry in an emergency vessel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I'll re-enter in the pod? I got friends out in space, Ryan, friends willing to get me back unnoticed.  Thank God for deregulation huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I think I've given you all the information you need to make  a sound decision.  But I'd advise you to hurry. Barnes leans closer to the microphone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you fifteen minutes to organize your information.  I'll take any further delay as a sign you've rejected the offer, and then of course, it's rescinded. Barnes then reaches over to a button -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over and out. Barnes then presses the button -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: They guests all look at one another - Taylor concentrates Warren approaches him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.  This can't be happening. Dawn approaches Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the screen showing the dining room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should do what he tells us. Barnes leans back and watches them, smiling -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dawn approaches Taylor, who inspects the sealed door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know he's not  bluffing? Taylor sees any attempt at opening the door is futile -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe there's a way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat chance of that.  Even if we had C4 and a laser torch these  doors wouldn't budge. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch...that stupid son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo and Dawn talk with Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given a malfunction, how would a rescue team get you out if the doors won't open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably come through the wall I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe we can do something like that. Taylor looks at Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you know what you're talking about.  Besides, what could  we use for tools?  A steak knife?  A corkscrew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just considering our options... sir. Dawn and Taylor look at each other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't try anything anyhow. He must be watching everything we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Taylor looks at the CONTROL PANEL next to the door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only I could override this thing. At the other end of the room Mac approaches Delbert who n cigarette -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the behalf of the Star Princess we apologize for any inconvenience you might experience -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here, will ya!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac backs off and walks away - Monica approaches Delbert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now what are we gonna do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Delbert Miles!  You have more clout than some whacked out pilot!  Talk to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him...Jesus... Nearby, Jack places a TABLECLOTH over a dead guest -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you one thing, I'm not giving him shit, not a password, not an access code, not the time  of day. Jack turns around and looks at Delbert -  Warren and Anna approach Delbert and Monica -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should do what he  asks. Delbert looks at her incredulously -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you do, huh?  Well let me tell you something lady, if you think that cracker is on the level, you're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a risk we can't afford to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can.  Use your head, do you  think he wants anyone around to say what happened? Jack approaches -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a chance he'll keep his end of the bargain, if we only cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Jack steps up and looks at Delbert -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  We're talking about life and death here.  I don't know why we're even having this  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what would you know about it? You don't have anything to lose. Jack gets closer to Delbert -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna give him those bank codes, you know why?  Because I'm telling you to, that's why.  I'm not losing my life over some greedy pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling a pig, rummy? Just then Jack SHOVES Delbert violently - Delbert CHARGES briefly before being separated by Warren -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Stop it!  Stop it! Delbert and Jack back off from one another, still staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just stay calm, ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this crap! Mac approaches Taylor, Dawn, and Carlo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am receiving a high level of negative feedback from our guest's comments.  Many expletives at a higher than usual decibel level. Taylor looks at Mac, then approaches the others -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, people, listen to me.  As the first mate, I know a lot about this ship.  Now I don't know what's going on outside these doors, I don't know where the captain is, I don't know who's left out here.  What I do know is that if what he's saying is true, we're in serious trouble.  So I  suggest we collect the information he wants, and give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's still no guarantee of anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a choice!  Now let's write them down, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposing we could get out of this room?  Is there anything we could do to reach the bridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends on the condition of  the ship.  If I could get to  one of the suit compartments I could check the exterior air locks for a possible entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we access the mainframe to check the ship's condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?  How am I going to  interface with it?  I need to be able to talk to the system and to have the system talk to me. Dawn looks at Taylor, who looks down at the ground -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're screwed.  Totally screwed. Suddenly something dawns on Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A way to talk to the system... Taylor then looks up at Mac - Dawn watches Taylor -  Taylor turns to Carlo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlo, get me the cable off the menu register. Carlo walks off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to be quick.

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes dials up a number in front of a video screen -  Soon the screen shows a FREIGHTER PILOT'S face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break it down to me, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like they're cooperating. Hopefully I'll be out of here and on my way very soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't drag your ass.  There won't be much of a window for us to link up.  We'll be in your orbit trajectory in less than two  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know Bill, I came up with the plan remember?  Just have those hangar doors open and ready, I can take it from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do.  What about the distress signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I really haven't made up my mind yet.  We'll see how nicely they behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's your call.  Doesn't make a damn bit of difference to  me.  Just as long as I get my cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you'll get it, believe me. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll see you in a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10-4 good buddy. Barnes reaches over to a button -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah, 10-4... Barnes disconnects the message -  He then gets up and approaches Reynolds, lying dead on th him for a beat -  He reaches into the bloody robe pocket and pulls out a

dialogues.speaker: CIGAR
dialogues.text: He smells the cigar, wets the tip, and lights it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame to waste a fine corona.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Carlo removes some cables from a computerized MENU MONITO approaches Taylor -  Taylor takes the cables and approaches the others -  Anna has finished writing down everyone's authorization c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  That's all of them. Taylor picks up the piece of paper -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we're doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we are, so get used to it. Taylor then approaches the Wall-mounted CAMERA LENS -  The others watch him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes.  Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Taylor's face can be seen on the monitor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes? Barnes takes a puff of the cigar, and looks at the monito

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, that's an affirmative, Roger Wilco.  Please proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the codes here.  How do you want to receive them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, preferably in tens and  twenties...

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor stares at the camera as the others watch -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a joke Taylor, lighten up!  Why don't you just hold them up to the lens.  I'll write them down, and once I'm through verifying them, I'll get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you transmit the distress signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I'm done verifying them. Can't be too trustworthy nowadays. Taylor slowly holds up the piece of paper to the lens -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the monitor showing the piece of paper listing t the passengers nest to their names - the list takes up th Barnes examines the list and begins entering the first nu another screen -  He then hits enter - the screen reads "CONNECTING WITH NE Barnes sits back -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor gestures to Carlo to come over - Carlo approaches him off the paper to hold up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Take this. Carlo does so and Taylor walks over to Mac -  Dawn undoes the front of the WALL PANEL with a knife -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...it's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen one like it before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It complies with all standard construction codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Taylor then turns and looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, I have a favor to ask you. Mac looks at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.  If you need anything,  please feel free to ask me.  Just a  reminder we have fabulous cuisine available --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I know all that.  Mac, I need you to help us out with a little technical problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.  I have a full working knowledge of the ships operations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I understand that... Taylor looks at Mac's face - Jack approaches -  Dawn begins to connect one end of the wire to the wall co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to actually do something for me.  I need to access your CPU, directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will not be necessary.  You can simply speak to me.  I understand  most languages fluently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but the ship's mainframe doesn't. I need you to tell it something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alteration of my central processing unit should be done only by an authorized service dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but we're in a bind. Mac waits a beat before saying anything -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alteration of my central processing unit should be done only by an authorized service dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn then turns and looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Mac, but the guests are  requesting it.                 (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will reduce the level of  negative feedback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is one of my priorities. Taylor looks at Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what I thought... Taylor and Jack look at Mac's face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now which one was it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the left one, I think.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STAR PRINCESS
dialogues.text: The ship drifts aimlessly in space, with the moon in the

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes continues to verify the authorization codes -  CLOSE on the MONITOR - Barnes types in the number - the s "CONNECTING TO NETBANK...", then a pause, then "NETBANK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes watches as a series of options appear:  BALANCE, T

dialogues.speaker: DEPOSIT
dialogues.text: Barnes selects BALANCE - there is a pause, then: AVAILABL Barnes sits back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, I should have been an actor. Barnes then types in some commands -  The screen then reads:

dialogues.speaker: "TRANSFER TO NETBANK _ _ _ _ _
dialogues.text: As Barnes types in the number, they appear as X'S -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the cable connected to the wall console -  The camera slowly pans, following the cable -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, the first thing we need to  know is the status of this floor. Taylor then gently moves the other end of the cable towar approach we see Mac's LEFT EYE removed, with a socket for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing. Taylor slowly inserts the cable into the socket -  Everyone waits for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Mac, can you tell me the status of this deck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment please... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one moment please... Dawn examines the EYEBALL then looks at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should.  Mac? Mac sits, motionless, with the cable hanging out of his  eye -  The others watch apprehensively -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This corridor is accessible, and we hope you enjoy it.  I'm sorry to say we are having  technical problems with...all exits on this level.  We apologize for this inconvenience. Taylor and Dawn sigh with relief -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the corridor outside this door is open, correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You can enjoy some wonderful views from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw the damn views!  Get us out of here you piece of crap! Taylor and the others glare at Delbert for a beat - Taylo attention on Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, what about the suit  compartments on this level?  Can they be accessed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  The suit compartments are in a non-oxygenated, zero gravity atmosphere.  I'm afraid that's off limits to all passengers. Taylor sits back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.  If only we could get to  those suits... Dawn then thinks of something -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the condition of the compartments.  Depending on damage, debris...could be a fatal mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you could hold your breath. Taylor looks at Jack -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suppose you couldn't hold out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you didn't have to hold  your breath? Taylor looks at Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could send Mac.  If he can retrieve one suit, we could go back for the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Taylor then looks at Jack - he raises his wrist -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, let me have your walkie. Put it on channel 10. Taylor than looks around, walks over to a chair, and SMAS picking up one of the steel legs -  Taylor then looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, Mac.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the doors to the dining room opening -  Mac exits the dining room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor places the chair leg between the two doors creatin to slide through -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok Mac... (shows Mac his walkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to you on this. I want to find a way to get to the bridge, then I want you to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.  Anything I can do to be of service. Mac heads down the hall -  Dawn and Taylor watch him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly is polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mac)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close every door behind you! Mac looks at Taylor, then heads around the corner -

dialogues.speaker: INT DAMAGED HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The doors open, and Mac enters the damaged hallway - loos debris and bodies litter the  hallway -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it looking, Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would recommend a maintenance crew in this sector.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor talks on his walkie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe for human transport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be oxygenated if we can hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's hope he can find a way through. Taylor cues his walkie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac please check the status of  the suit compartment on this level I want you to go in there and get a suit.

dialogues.speaker: INT DAMAGED HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mac approaches the door at the other end -  The door does not open automatically - Mac stares at it f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will manually open the door, and will report this problem to maintenance. Mac raises his hand to the PANEL on the wall -  As he does the wrist walkie gets near A LIVE WIRE jutting As Mac punched in a number -  The cable TOUCHES the walkie, and a SURGE of electricity

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor hears a loud CRACKLE emit from his walkie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: INT DAMAGED HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mac gets BLASTED against the wall of the hallway -  He reels for a beat, then staggers a few steps -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have experienced a critical error...I have experienced a  critical error...I will review my previous commands. Mac enters the commands on the panel, and the door opens

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor cues his walkie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac.  Mac!

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes finishes tallying the total he has transferred -  CLOSE on the monitor showing the grand total - $368,422,0 Barnes sits back, smiles, and takes a puff of his cigar -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for a day's work. Suddenly there is a bell indicating someone trying to ent Barnes swings around -  He checks the monitor and sees it is Mac, waiting outside Barnes grabs up his gun and approaches the door -  He opens the door, all the time aiming his weapon -  Mac stares at him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you come  from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello second mate Barnes. I was instructed to come to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac reels for a beat, leans on the hallway wall -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do for you? Barnes looks around the hallway, then looks at Mac and sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Come on in pally.  Take a load off. Mac enters the room -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor listens to his walkie as the others stand around  him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac.  Mac can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.  It was working fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the walkie shorted out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes sits down with a smile on his face, and listens to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how did you get here, Mac? I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to pass through several  restricted areas.  I am sensing a high level of passenger  dissatisfaction, which is my duty to report. Barnes revels in this encounter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't you down in the dining room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there.  Officer Taylor accessed my CPU directly to open the airlock doors.  They are not functioning properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he did, did he? The smile fades from Barnes' face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he did.  Yes he did. Barnes looks at the monitor - Taylor and the others are s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything to the monitors, did you Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did nothing to the monitors. Barnes watches the screen carefully -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are they doing now, Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are awaiting further  information. Barnes looks at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you going to give it to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here to provide service to... to all our guests.  There is a high level of passenger dissatisfaction.   It is my duty...to report this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you did the right thing Mac. Barnes gets up - he sees the wrist walkie on Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you were communicating with officer Taylor over the wrist walkie? Barnes inspects the walkie, notices it is on channel 10 - he laughs and shakes his head -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On channel 10?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The device has stopped responding. Barnes looks up at Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're going to have to  do something about that aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor listens to the walkie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, can you hear me?  Come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor, you surprise me. Taylor looks up in disbelief -

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes talks into his walkie - Mac sits in the background

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never send an android to do a man's work.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor and the others listen carefully -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do.  Sending Mac out on a little recon work.  How pathetic.  Problem is it seems Mac blew a few fuses. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe he's just a little drunk. Were you partying with a robot Taylor? Taylor begins to lose his patience -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look we gave you what you asked  for.  It checks out didn't it?! What more do you want from us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to try anything smart!  I guess you're too much of a maverick to follow a simple order!  And that's just too bad for all of you now, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look you said it doesn't matter to you anyway!  Why do you want  to kill more innocent people!  Why! Barnes gets up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you want a diatribe about  my agenda to get even with the  world, or some crap.

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Taylor and the others listen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not that complex.  I  don't give a damn about the haves, and I don't give a damn about the have- nots.  And I sure as hell don't give a damn about any of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's business.  Period.  If you followed directions, you might have  had a chance.  But all that's all  over now. Barnes then heads over to the console and adjusts some eq

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I will do,  though.  I'll make sure you all see  the moon.  Unfortunately it will have to be a one way trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in closing I'd like to thank all of you for your generous contributions and thanks for flying the Star  Princess.  Watch your step on the way  out.  Bye bye. Taylor lowers his walkie - the others respond with sunken

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Barnes throws the walkie on the console, smiling to  himself - he then approaches Mac and puts on a look of mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac, you really earned your wings this flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My...wings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your wings. Mac reels for a beat, then continues -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here to provide service to... to all our guests.  There is a high level of passenger dissatisfaction.   It is my duty...to report this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you Mac and I appreciate it. Frankly I don't know what I'd have done without you on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a high level...of passenger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I intend to correct that at once. I'll tell you something Mac... Barnes puts his arm around Mac -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really gonna go far in this business.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SPACESHIP
dialogues.text: An AIRLOCK ENTRANCE can be seen - suddenly Mac SHOOTS out away from the ship -  Mac disappears into the void, arms and legs akimbo, looki

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the monitor with a view of the exterior as Mac d Barnes HOWLS with laughter, bending over, slapping the co He gets up, laughing even harder, SHOUTING with laughter He then opens a panel and begins flipping switch after sw

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The lights go out in ascending order down the hall -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Suddenly the lights begin to shut off and the send of an heard -  The occupants all look at one another -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, what is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shutting off the air!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lousy, stinking son of a bitch! Delbert picks up a chair - charges toward the CAMERA -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lousy - Delbert flings the chair - SMASSSSHHHHH!!!! The chair sha

dialogues.speaker: INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the camera monitor going blank -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Monica rushes over to Delbert,  whose rage disguises his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delbert!  What's gonna happen? Delbert pulls his arm away but Monica grabs it again -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delbert! Delbert looks at her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.  I'm really scared! Delbert looks back at her, unable to hide his fear -  Jack looks at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Taylor concentrates -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might still be playing a game with us.  But at this point the odds are slim, he's already killed too many others. Dawn approaches Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what's the next step? Taylor and Dawn look at each other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the use...we're gonna die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that!  It ain't over till it's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a question of getting to the  lifepod.  Before Barnes does. But even then, the pod has a maximum capacity of seven adults.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's eight of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we'll just cram in! Taylor glares at Delbert -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work that way! There's only so much oxygen, only so much  fuel, only so much mass it can handle on re-entry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could get to the bridge I could send the distress signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we do, it might be too late. Taylor looks at the room -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have no other choice. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get to the suit compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was too risky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting him get away with this.  It's our last chance. Taylor heads toward the door -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone just stay put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Dawn approaches Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you. Taylor looks at her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I know what I'm doing. I have experience and training in space walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simulated space walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might need assistance, you don't know what your facing. Dawn looks around the room, then looks at Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go crazy sitting here. I'd  rather risk it. Taylor looks at her for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right come on. Taylor looks at the others -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone just stay calm.  Everything's going to be all right. Taylor looks at Jack -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, keep it together in here. Jack looks at him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best. Taylor and Dawn leave through the opening in the door Carlo watches them - there is a look of real anxiety on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut up already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you one thing, I'm not gonna just lie down and die for this crackpot.  The hell with that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you going to do,  genius? Delbert looks at her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't quite made up my mind yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what you're gonna do.  You're gonna stay put like Taylor said. Delbert approaches Jack -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again with the orders from you! You got a Napoleon complex chief, and I'm getting sick of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you two please stop it!  I  don't want to spend my final hours listening to you bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what I'm going to do. The others look at Warren -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have myself a drink. Warren walks over to the bar -

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Dawn and Taylor make their way down the darkened hallway collapsed ceiling panels -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step. Taylor approaches a sealed door - he looks at it for a  beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's through this door. Taylor then looks at Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what we're facing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. They look at each other for a beat -  Taylor takes a deep breath -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready as I'll ever be. Taylor nods at her - he then looks at the door -  Taylor's hand approaches the emergency lock release -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing. Taylor hits the button -  CLOSE on the doors - they SWOOSH open -

dialogues.speaker: INT SUIT COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: The pressurized room BLASTS  Taylor and Dawn into the sma several large recessed LOCKERS - there is NO SOUND WHATSO They struggle to anchor themselves as they slam around th dangerously close to a GAPING HOLE in the wall leading ou Dawn grabs onto a railing for dear life, her face contort oxygen and the brutal cold -  Taylor RIPS OPEN one of the lockers containing a SPACE  SUIT - the door swings open and shut violently as Taylor Dawn struggles to get closer to another one of the locker FROST rapidly begins to form on her hand and the railing Taylor slips and slams backward - but through sheer will locker door, and pulls out the suit's HELMET - he lets go holding the helmet -  He slams into Dawn and hands her the helmet - she, too, l propelled around the room -  Taylor then opens another locker and repeats the procedur another helmet -  By this time dawn has gone to the first locker and remove get into it while keeping her bearings -  Taylor puts on the helmet and follows suit, grabbing anot locker -  Almost at the point of bursting, Dawn begins to lock the Taylor continues to do the same, getting the arm of the s Dawn floats over to the railing - she grabs it and positi Taylor finally frees the stuck jacket and continues getti CLOSE on Dawn as she uses her free hand to press some com of the suit -  A small LIGHT goes on in her helmet - soon she begins to incoming oxygen - soon a look of relief crosses her face Taylor continues to struggle with the suit - Dawn heads o Taylor LOCKS DOWN his helmet -  Just then Dawn reaches over and presses the buttons the f The small light goes on in Taylor's helmet - he, too, beg if for dear life -  Slinking back from exhaustion, Taylor looks over at Dawn Dawn looks back at him - slowly, a smile crosses her face Slowly, Taylor smiles back at her - he presses a button o we hear his voice through the HELMET SPEAKER -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Dawn looks at the suit, and presses the button on her for Taylor -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we did. Taylor then heads over to the gaping hole in the wall -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's what I call an emergency  exit. Taylor inspects it and looks out into space - he then tur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ready for the real thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point I'm ready for  anything. Taylor smiles at her - he slowly makes his way out of the closely behind -

dialogues.speaker: INT DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Carlo, who stares despondently at the ground -  Delbert paces as Monica watches him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, something's not right here. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know they're not going to use the pod for themselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, Taylor wouldn't do that, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure? Jack looks at Delbert with contempt -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking now, I'm begging. Please shut up!

dialogues.speaker: INT WINE ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Warren corking a vintage wine -  Just then Anna enters, closing the door behind her -  Warren shows Anna the bottle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2059...a very good year. Warren then takes an ENORMOUS swig of the wine, then wipe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some?  It's got a  hearty bouquet. Anna approaches, and takes the bottle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting drunk is no solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...I forgot my morphine back in the room. Anna looks at him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, have some.  In fact... Warren peruses the other bottles on the wall -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the whole thing.  There's plenty more where that came from. Warren selects another bottle -  Anna takes a sip of the wine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess this is it. Warren opens another bottle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.  Finished.  Kaput. Over. Warren corks the bottle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Warren Wayne's going out in style. Warren takes a swig of the wine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little sweet.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STAR PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Slowly Taylor and Dawn rise into the frame, and hover ove grabbing onto handles placed around the area -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, you don't want to  puncture the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the other side.  There's an airlock close to engineering. If it's intact, I can get to  the pressure vents. Suddenly Taylor sees something -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? Taylor approaches a section of the ship and scrutinizes i Dawn looks in that direction - POV Taylor grabs a chunk OF C4 PLASTIC EXPLOSIVE attached

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Barnes' duds, luckily for us.  Take this out of the equation right now... Taylor puts the C4 into a STORAGE POUCH on his suit -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That psychotic bastard... Taylor looks back a Dawn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go. Dawn follows him - they look at each other -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think's going to  happen to us? Taylor looks back at Dawn -
